newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary Feb PMI index 50.4 pct vs Jan 46.0 pct.
newsitem.headline: Hungary Feb PMI index 50.4 pct vs Jan 46.0 pct.

text.p: Hungary's Purchasing Manager Index (PMI) was 50.4 percent in February, up from 46 percent in January, the Hungarian Association of Logistics, Purchasing and Inventory Management (HALPIM) said on Wednesday.
The following is a history of the index over the year on a month-to-month basis:

NOTE: The PMI is calculated using the same methodology as the United States' National Association of Purchasing Management Index. A figure above 50 indicates increasing economic activity, while a number below 50 shows declining economic activity.
The rise of the February index was due to seasonal factors, HALPIM said.
